actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend the Small Business Act to provide assistance for small business export activities, to transfer certain disaster relief functions of the Small Business Administration to other Federal agencies.
subjects: Department of Housing and Urban Development

summary.text: Small Business Export Development Act - Establishes within the Small Business Administration an office of Export Development to encourage and assist small businesses interested in understanding or increasing export activities. Authorizes to be appropriated such sums as are necessary to establish such office. Requires the Export-Import Bank to provide at least $5,000,000 worth of loans, guarantees, or insurance to finance exports by small business concerns. Transfers existing SBA functions relating to disaster loans to the Secretaries of Commerce, Agriculture, and Housing and Urban Development. Provides that whenever the SBA determines that small business concerns are or are likely to be at an operational or financing disadvantage with other business concerns with respect to the planning, design, or installation of pollution control facilities, or the obtaining of private financing therefor, it may guarantee the payment of rentals or other amounts due under qualified contracts, and any such guarantee shall be for the full amount of the payments due under such qualified contract.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Small Business Act to provide assistance for small business export activities, to transfer certain disaster relief functions of the Small Business Administration to other Federal agencies.
